Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot right off Via Del Corso. A little further from the Metro than indicated (but a write-up here had warned us and I'm very familiar with Rome anyway) and tricky to find (no street sign). But worth it. RIght in the middle of everything. I had my in-laws traveling with me and my wife and 6yr old and we had an awesome suite. Well-furnished and turned out rooms with nice bathrooms. Small balcony with a great view. Rooms were small (which is typical for Rome) but the comforts made it worth it. And, afterall, I'm not in Rome to hang out in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Montecitorio”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location of the hotel. Nice clean bathroom. Helpful receptionists. The window wouldn't close, so had to put the heater on maximum and really noisy one night. Room was quite small though but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Ann X
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location just off Via Del Corso. The rooms are clean, warm and a good size. They have free Wifi. The hotel staff was very welcoming and efficient. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The little extras make it special”
Reviews.Author: renette k
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical of all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, but when my husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in October we really enjoyed our stay. Our room was amazing, comfortable and bigger than we expected with a view of Rome. We agree with others that the bathroom was a little bit style over function - not enough light to apply make-up (me) or shave (my husband), and the shower design meant slight leaks on the floor. The happy hour was great, as were the free coffees (had at least one a day), free laptop set up with Wifi was handy. we also had some good advice on where to dine thanks to Mr. Paul, Porto of Ripetta really good restaurant All in all, if you can get a good rate, I would thoroughly recommend it. Renette k.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelollypops
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 2 nights. This hotel is in a terrific location on the 3rd floor of a big building, just off the via del corso. We were in close proximity to all the main sights. Our room was clean, nicely decorated and consisted of a queen size bed and a set of bunk beds. [I suggest that the top bunk bed needs a railing around the top for safety]. We had a balcony but didn't use as too small, but it was nice to have a view of the street. The shower did run out of hot water one night but came back again after a short wait. When we first arrived we made our way up to the 3rd floor - half of our party at a time as the lift was not large enough, carted our bags up 2 sets of stairs - only to be told that we were in another part of the building and would have to drag everything down again to the bottom and over to the other part of the building and even more stairs! This should have been clearly stated to us when we first buzzed in - and were seen on the tv monitors. Apart from this, which was very annoying, the staff were very good and gave us a fabulous restaurant recommendation for dinner - we ended up dining there every night. The staff also booked us a transfer to the airport in a private car which was very clean [and fast].

Reviews.Title: “Holidays in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Florentia O
Reviews.Content: I have read three reviews some days before my journey and I was very disappointed, I thought of changing my reservation. This would be a big mistake! I and my friends stayed there for three days. The location of the Hotel is ideal. The entrance is on the third floor but we didn’t have trouble to find it. On our arrival Mr. Giuseppe was very friendly, he provided us with maps and useful information but the other stuff was also helpful. The room was clean and was reasonably priced for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Maddon0
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION! However, I just stayed 3 nights at this hotel and was terribly disappointed. The pictures are deceiving on the website. Where to start....the walls are thin, windows don't close all the way, bed mattress is thin and uncomfortable, bathroom desperately needs remodeling and has the world's smallest shower, layout of the room is poor, floors were dirty. I could go on-and-on. Staff seemed just as miserable working there and did not have enough manners to even greet guests. Every time you asked them a question or walked up to the front desk, they seemed annoyed. I must say that upon arrival, Aga was very nice. Other than her, the hotel was not worth the price (even based on European standards). Shame on me for not doing a better job of reading reviews and choosing a more decent hotel. The address of the hotel is not visible on the street. Thank goodness the taxi driver knew the hotel, otherwise we would have been looking for hours for the dump. Oh, website didn't mention that the hotel is within a building shared by other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not Anymore....”
Reviews.Author: FreeFlayer
Reviews.Content: In general most of the hotels in Rome are bad and expensive but Hotel Montecitorio is really one of the worst place value for money. Rooms are very little i think they are less than 10 square meters, bed were really uncomfortable and the window could be closed properly. When we arrived the bathroom was not cleaned.... At the reception they made us pay 2 euros per day person as en extra tax that was not reported in the voucher... For 140 euros per day without breakfast I would have a expected a much better place.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel...do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: sgm111
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a week but had to leave after one night: the room was tiniest and noisiest even by European standards...Furthermore, in violation their own cancellation policy, they charge us for an extra night, after we decided to move out...We join other numerous travelers who also stayed at that hotel with this warming: AVOID THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Gantraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Montecitorio is a great place to sleep. You won't find a luxurious lobby, or a gourmet restaurant, it has neither of these things. But the rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, the air conditioning works very well, and the price is extremely reasonable, for the historical centre of Rome. Our room was very small -- the king-sized bed took up most of it -- but the bathroom was quite large. There is no restaurant, but you're only steps from several bars and restaurants. On the first morning, we found a nice little bar around the corner (Bar della Vite) from the hotel and quickly became well-looked-after regulars for breakfast. We walked everywhere in Rome, which was easily done from our hotel's very central location. A luxurious hotel is a nice treat, but we decided that we'd rather spend our money on fabulous dinners and souvenirs, than hotel extras. We would stay at the Montecitorio again.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: stephanie345
Reviews.Content: I went there the summer of 2009 and there were BED BUGS. The front desk guy wouldn't give us our money back. We got into a huge fight with him and the police even got involved. They are such liars! we had to move to another much more expensive hotel. It was gross. DONT GO

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but totally not satisfactory.”
Reviews.Author: s1983
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It's located right in the middle of via del Corso. But the first impression is depressing. First, it is a little bit hard to locate it, since it is not like an ordinary hotel image you have in mind. It is located on the third floor of a building, hard to find. The receptionist is not friendly at all, or appeared to me so at least, and each word she says is like that you have forced her to talk. The room is not terrible, but the whole decoration and building is so old. The price is relatively high and the breakfast is not served also. The safety box of my room also didn't work and the receptionist told me that it was my problem, and I had to carry my money and passport with me all day long! I changed my place after the first night and I am thankful that at least they didn't charge me more than they did, for cancellation!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MacFamily35
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at Hotel Montecitorio. Our first trip was good , but our 2nd stay not as pleasureable. Upon on our arrival, we were given a room the size of a closet without a laptop and internet as they advertise. We asked for a laptop, so eventually we were relocated into another room which was bigger but stunk of smoke. There is a little balcony and we found a lot of butts, I mean a few packs worth. So I am thinking the staff uses this room to smoke, since it was cleaned the next day. I didn't complain for another room, since we were only there 2 nights and I didn't want to spend my time changing rooms. The room is clean and bathroom was big. There is no breakfast but that is fine because the last time we were there, the breakfast was terrible considering we were in Rome. The location is ideal, close to all the main places to see when in Rome. It is also very close to great shopping. The hotel is good as long as you get the good rooms. Don't be afraid to ask for what you want.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: rprz
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night stay at Montecitorio. The location was great, within 5-10 minute walk of Trevi fountain, Spanish steps (Spagna Metro station), Pantheon and Piazza Navona. We had a quad and it was on the small side. The bathroom was OK. The room was cleaned everyday. We had a room that was on the side of the street, so you can hear the noise from traffic at night. Guisseppe, who covers the night shift was really nice, and explained to us the best way to get to the different sites. He even recommended pizzerias and restaurants around the area. There is a piazza, a block away where you can take bus #62 to get to the Vatican. You can also catch a cab from there, back to the airport. It's only 40 Eur. Breakfast was not included in our stay. This however, was not a problem, since there is a cafe next to the piazza. So every morning, we just buy croissants and pastries before we hit the road. The location feel safe even past midnight. The nice thing about the hotel is the free internet access via a provided laptop in the room. There is also a 46" plasma TV, and safe. The bad thing about the place is the free internet, because my teenage kids just wanted to get back to the hotel room instead of hanging out late at the Pantheo n or Trevi. The airconditioner was good enough. The bed was a bit hard but it never bothered us. Overall, it was a nice experience, and won't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's changed, Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: leeview
Reviews.Content: I have just been there in April 2009 for 8 days with my wife and our mothers, so we booked 2 rooms, boths great, clean, just how you see them on their website. The hotel is not on construction anymore, the elevator is working fine, location can't be beaten, no breakfast but there are several restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Staff is speaking english. I had just a minor problem that the laptop in my room couldn't connect to the internet so I asked them for another one and they gave me. Bathrooms clean, vibro-massage shower...I recomend this hotel from all my heart.

Reviews.Title: “no more breakfast”
Reviews.Author: libtravel
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. Good location (close to Spanish Steps), updated rooms, good bathrooms. This hotel no longer serves breakfast. After reading the good reviews of the breakfast it was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. there is a coffee shop across the street that you can buy something in the morning. the first morning we ran out of hot water in the shower (3 of us) and planned accordingly for the next day. Also, just be warned that the people at the front desk aren't fluent in english (not a problem but something to be aware of). Also it seems like they have put in a new phone system and are still getting used to it. There are 2 stairwells in the property. You need to go through the courtyard to the back set of stairs to access this hotel. Hotel Parlemento is in the same building.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and our room”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCy01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in April 2008. We were given a room on the fifth floor on the building next where the reception is. Our room was really nice and clean and it seemed like it has been revovatated recently. Bathroom was ok - no bathtup just a shower which we prefered. The reception staff was really helpful and nice. The location of the hotel is perfect. Just off Via Del Corso (shopping street) we walked everywhere from the spanish steps to the vatican city (just a 20 minute walk ) and to the colosseum- the weather was really nice. Just a two minor points on the hotel- in the morning we could hear other residents talking in the corridor and we didn't like breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone- I would definitely go back- but ask for a room in the new block not in the block where the reception is. Btw at first it looks like a maze to get from the reception to the room, cause you have to go through several doors!! C. A. 05/05/2008

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: AMYWISS
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and okay size. Nice bathroom. Stairs stairs and more stairs. Elevator not available from street level. Breakfast was okay - coffee / tea / juice / rolls delivered to your room after 8 am. Night staff not very friendly and quite gruff. The location was very good. About 6-7 blocks from the Metro stop at the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: jacko8212
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August, 2007. While I had found the hotel on-line and booked the rooms prior to reading the Trip Advisor reviews, I must say that we were very happy with the overall experience and would recommend the hotel to those travelers who are not seeking a luxury property. The location is fantastic, right off Via del Corso near one of the main terminus points for the bus lines and within a few blocks of the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The subway is also a short walk away up Via Tritone. The hotel had very clean, though also small, rooms with free internet access and large plasma TVs. There was one English language channel, a British version of CNN. We heard virtually no noise at night - there was some construction in the courtyard during the day. The staff was friendly and courteous. We spoke some Italian, so were able to communicate, but many of the desk staff also spoke passable English. The hotel does have 3 flights of stairs to walk up... not a problem for us .... and the breafast is basic. Still, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a central location in Rome and is willing to sacrifice the luxury amenities for a very reasonably price.

Reviews.Title: “You really get you moneys worth!”
Reviews.Author: Bambi111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights to celebrate our fifth anniversity and we both thought that the hotel was great. We had a wonderful private bath, a nice big tv and a computer with internet access. The breakfast was okey, it was served in our room and I love breakfast in bed :) The staff was friendly and helpful, they called a taxi for us, etc. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere! It is very close to Fontana di Trevi and the Spanish Steps, only 5-10 minutes walk. But we also walked to the Vatican, Colosseum and Trastevere. So we think that we really got our moneys worth, since it was really reasonable prices for such a great location and nice room (and that is what you are paying for!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: neevrene
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - right between the spanish steps and the Trevi fountain and a fairly easy trip from Termini train station. The rooms were clean and the staff were friendly and spoke very good English. However, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who is unfit or has heavy bags as there are several flights of stairs to carry your luggage up and no lift. It is under construction at the moment and so the court yard was full of cement and scaffolding. Despite this there was no noise. I would stay here again based on how centrally located it was.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: yorkiedogs
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this Hotel if you have luggage, or want to eat their breakfast. No matter how you count it, you go up 4 floors and walk all the way. No elevator, and no one to help you, it is a nightmare. Thank goodness our Cab driver wanted to make a little extra money and he carried our 4 suticases up the 4 flights. Going down the steps was not much better. The hotel is under construction so you have to dodge mixers, bags of cement and other construction items. it was bad but comical if you have a good sense of humor. We tried to cancel the reservations that we had made when we got back in town, but they said you have to do it on the Internet. We tried to get into the site for cancelling but it could not be done. We even had the man at the Internet Cafe try and he couldn't do it either. No reason they could not have done it right at the Hotel. Our breakfast was not served so we had to go out and eat. Not a good place to stay other than the staff was friendly and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “No! No! Don't stay in this hotel! Never!”
Reviews.Author: angrytourist
Reviews.Content: We are very unhappy that we reserved this hotel for weekend. We asked for picking up servise from airport and they send for us confirmation, but nobody was waiting for us, we were waiting in airport one hour, and then take taxi ourself. Nobody informed us that building of hotel is under construction, so entrance to hotel was terrible, we couldn't normally open windows in our rooms, so we felt ourself like in dark box. Hotel, if it can be called "hotel", is realy not on second fluor, but on 4 and there is no lift. TV in our room was broken, it had no sound and nobody during 3days didn"t fix this problem. And when the last evening before leaving this terrible place we ask old man in reception why nobody fixed sound, he said "it"s not my problem"! We can"t believe in that we heard!!! So never reserve this hotel if you don't want to make your holiday terrible! !!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but beware if you're at all unfit ...”
Reviews.Author: Cath A
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel Montecitorio. The plus things are that the bathroom was lovely - very spacious and with a spa shower (though no bath); there was the biggest TV in the world in the room - plasma screen, though all Italian stations (which suited us as we are trying hard to learn Italian and watching TV from time to time is not a bad way of learning!); the hotel was immaculately clean and well kept; and its location is perfect. But more than anything we valued the wonderful air conditioning which comes free (a lot of other hotels we looked at charge 10 euros per day). In a Rome where temperatures were in the high 30s this was a real life-saver. On the minus side - the room, described as a 'double deluxe' - was very small and cramped (didn't bother us as we were out most of the time, but I suspect would be a huge shock in particular to American travellers); there was scaffolding outside our window and building work going on in the foyer which we weren't warned about; the staff weren't terribly welcoming (though having said that we needed to locate some sheet music and one of the receptionists was incredibly helpful and eventually tracked it down - but basics like booking in and general greetings were sparse and unfriendly, and on booking out the machine refused to work and left us scrabbling round cash machines nearby to get the cash together); the breakfasts were awful - delivered to the room and consisted of a plastic cup of juice, a small cup of coffee, milk forgotten on all but one day, and one small bun each, with butter and maramalade. But most of all take note that this hotel is up several flights of stairs and there is no lift available. Dragging cases up there without either a lift or a concierge caused serious problems to a lot of people we met - we helped many of them get to the top with heavy cases. So if you are at all disabled, or even a bit unfit, reaching your room will be a problem and this is not the hotel for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Warning for others”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. I booked this hotel for 9 young girls and I to stay during a choir trip. When we arrived at 11:00 pm, I was told that they had rooms for the girls, but not for me --their teacher/guardian. " Don't worry,” said the concierge, “I think there's a room at a hotel around the corner". When I explained why I couldn’t abandon a group of minors, he just rambled excuses: he started by blaming construction work, then changed his story to one about a horrible accident, then a new one about a broken window. I listened to all of this until about 1:00 am, then ended up staying at a different hotel (which I found out of sheer luck). Sadly, this is not the end of the saga. The next day, no apologies were given - but a different concierge found that an error had been made in the original price they quoted at the time of booking. I had to pay an extra 200 euros because of their mistake. Another person in our group was asked to pay 140 euros more than expected because of the same problem. I asked to speak to the manager on several occasions, but each concierge said that he/she was the director. I love Rome, but I couldn’t wait to get out of that dodgy place. If you want a stressful, expensive, argument-filled, construction-surrounded, dusty, noisy, smelly holiday in Rome – you now know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2327
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, we weren't sure what to expect. It's true there is no lift but the stairs were manageable. The breakfast was basically a hot drink, juice and a bad roll in a packet but you're not paying for the food. There was some building work going on but it didn't bother us too much. This hotel is so central those minor bad points become irrelevant. It is a few steps away from the Pantheon, Trevi, Spanish Steps, Piazza Venizia and 2 doors off Via del Corso. We walked everywhere including the Vatican, the Forum and Piazza del Popolo in 3 days. The room wasn't huge but was newly decorated to a high standard. The TV was huge, not great recption though and had 2 english channels but the laptop & internet made up for it. The bathroom was lovely, the shower had power jets and a seat (though this does limit the space for turning round!!!!) All in all we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Italy (Florence) for many years, I did not have any problems finding the hotel. Hotels with little signage and located in apartment buildings are a norm in this country...just look for the big green door. The room was small but well appointed and very clean, with plasma television and laptop with free internet access. This is an exceptional service for the price point (100 Euro a night). The shower is very small, so those who are larger-sized need to take this into consideration. I am 5'6" and 130lbs, and I found it tight! The location is ideal, off the major street Via del Corso, which bisects Rome. The Spanish Steps, Piazza Venezia, Piazza Navona and the Trevi Fountain are all a walkable distance. And the clerks will provide you with a map. Some problems: the breakfast is meager (but again, a norm for Italy) and not served on time. The night clerk is an old man with an extremely thick Roman accent. I have spoken Italian for years and still found him difficult to understand. Good luck, for he doesn't speak English! Moreover, he smokes all night long, which is now illegal in Italy. Our room (which was on the same floor as reception) stunk during the night. The phone in the rooms only call reception. To make outside calls, you need to make them from the reception desk. Or purchase a phone card and call from a public phone. If travelling alone, or for those on a budget, or those who are only concerned about location, I recommend the hotel. But, if you want a more comfortable home-base, especially after a long day touring the sites, I would suggest looking elsewhere, and even spending the extra Euros for a more swanky hotel on the Via Veneto, where the staff is more professional and fully trained to accomodate you. This is more of a "mom and pop" establishment. Buon viaggio.

Reviews.Title: “great if you want to be close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To provide a balanced view, my family (including myself, wife and two young children 6 & 7) stayed at the hotel in November and like many of you researched on the web and read trip advisor so our expectations were set! The room (quadruple) was more than adequate because we did not come to Roma to stay in a hotel but to be out and about to enjoy the delights of the eternal city. So location wise, you will be hard to beat it amd yes after just about finding it and using the stairs (we were lucky as our room was just on the reception level) we were ready to go! Breakfast was fine and there is a cafe just opposite if you wanted to top up but again we did not stay at the hotel for the cusisine when Italy has restaurants and cafe's in abundance! all in all, reasonable value, enough room and customer service was fine - everyone was most attentive to our needs when asked so I encourage anyone to stay here and look beyond the "climbing of stairs, average breakfast and non American style hotel floor space". You are 3 minutes walk from the Trevi and 6 minutes from the Spanish steps and you get a look at life in a central apartment - including noise and all but that's Roma! enjoy the Jandu Family visited from germany - though English by birth!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service....we are not obligated to provide that are we????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first surprise when you arrive late at night, is there is no hotel name visible. No worries, you make a call and then they confirm you are in the right location. A relatively unfriendly man comes down and escorts us inside, yet does not offer to assist with our bags. He walks ahead of us leaving us to struggle with our 40kg's of luggage up 3 flights of steps. Great customer service. We check in and head to our room. Our room is actually really nice. 'Breakfast' if you can call it that, is an absolute waste of time. Definitely skip it. Next morning we meet the hotel manager to try and sorrt out some issues. End up having a stand up arguement with the arrogant italian. It ends up with the arrogant italian saying, to our disbeleif, "We are not obligated to provide you with customer service." To this we walk out absolutely fuming to start our exploration of this amazing city. Nice hotel with some very significant short comings. Suggest you DO NOT stay here and try something else.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice rooms, which compensates for other flaws”
Reviews.Author: Chuckles960
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have said, there is no elevator (we took the Hotel Parlamento's elevator and then came down one flight of stairs). Also, the breakfast is indeed poor, but at our request they provided fresh rolls to supplement that disgusting packaged croissant. But the rooms are VERY nice, with beautiful floors, a comfortable bed, and a nice bathroom. We somehow snagged a low rate of 105 euros in very early Sept. (you may not be as lucky---the price went up steeply after we booked our room) and this was unexpected luxury at that price point. The location is incredibly convenient, but we heard no traffic or other noises. The laptop and plasma TV worked fine. Our stay was somewhat spoiled by very rude behavior from the night clerk (the theatrical guy with crazy eyes and bushy mustache and eyebrows). The day staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice SMALL hotel, had a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: GuyinSF
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the hotel. A friend of mine and I stayed in a two twin room and paid 130 euros for each night and another couple travelling with us stayed in a double room. Their website is misleading. NO ELEVATOR, you have to climb 3 to 4 flights of stairs. Breakfast is prepackaged and brought to your room. It is very HARD to find the hotel, as the only identification is their name on the directory near the entrance. The room was not very big (but most hotels in Rome are not), and I tripped over the luggage a few times. The shower is small. In the particular room I was in, I felt like I was showering in a capsule (and I'm a small person). Don't drop the soap! The same goes for the double room my other friends stayed in. With those things in mind, the pluses are: The hotel clerks were very friendly and helpful; the room was very clean and was renovated earlier this year. There is a plasma t.v. on the wall and they have free internet access via a lap top that is provided. Located in a good section of town and the room was quiet. The colesium was a 15 minute walk and the Panthenon about 10 minutes away. If you are going to take a taxi from the airport, make arrangements for their taxi service. It costs the same as the other taxis and they know exactly where the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “to know beforehand-hotel montecitorio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is probably a fine place for people with little luggage and who do not mind climbing 4 flights of stairs-we had to change hotels. Also, we had booked a quad room which was a small double with 2 single beds added. Last thing-it's difficult to find the hotel once you enter the main door-you must go around the corner and up the steps-there are two elevators, but neither are for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome is a superb city and hotel prices are as high as in any European country. We stayed in June 2005 in Hotel Montecitorio in the middle of the Rome. The hotel was nice with friendly staff. However, we found a contrast with some of the details in the advetising of the hotel (internet) and the services in Rome. There was no breakfast buffet or even a breakfast room in the hotel. The full italian breakfast meant just some packed biscuits with a cup of coffee in your room. Either there is no lift in the hotel so you have carry your luggage to the floors. Arriving late and dark, to find this hotel is a mystery. Unlike in other hotels in Europe, this hotel has no sign or any other symbol, just a piece of name in a doorbell. Kirsti and Jorma, Helsinki, Finland

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the -----”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I researched dilligently to find a small, boutique hotel in Rome via the web using trip advisor. We selected Montecitorio out of about 10 contenders. We confirmed our reservation 6 weeks prior to traveling from New Zealand by utilising the services of a native Italian friend who phoned the hotel to confirm our fax/email reservation. After two days of travel (New Zealand is a looooong way away from everywhere), we arrived at the hotel, hot, sweaty and exhausted only to be told 'There is a problem with your reservation....but it is no problem - e have booked you in somewhere else'. I am sure that this hotel is consistent with the excellent reviews that it has received via this forum - but we will never know because the ------ bumped us, probably in favour of a dollar waving Yank! Most disapointed to be treated like this when we were anticipating a marvelous stay in a hotel that we had carefully selected and booked months in advance. The good news is that we enjoyed our stay in Rome despite this setback, and a currently enjoying an excellent hotel in Florence (Davadnzati). Grandad was right in not feeling guilty about potting Ities during WW2. Not that we are bitter or anything.....

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Montecitorio
HotelInfo.Address: Via delle Convertite 5, 00187 Rome, Italy
